DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : MS-275 may stop growth cancer cell block enzymes necessary growth . PURPOSE : This phase I trial study side effect best dose MS-275 treating patient advance solid tumor lymphoma .
DOC.brief_title: MS-275 Treating Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors Lymphoma
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine dose-limiting toxicity maximum tolerate dose MS-275 patient advance solid tumor lymphomas . - Determine profile adverse event , include change laboratory parameter , patient treat drug . - Assess pharmacology pharmacokinetics drug patient . - Design MS-275 regimen possibly frequent dose administration base pharmacology MS-275 use schedule study . - Determine antineoplastic activity drug patient . OUTLINE : This open-label , dose-escalation study . Patients receive oral MS-275 day 1 . Courses repeat every 2 week ( every 2-week schedule ) . Alternatively , patient receive oral MS-275 day 1 , 8 , 15 , 22 ( weekly schedule ) . Courses repeat every 6 week . Treatment schedule continue absence disease progression unacceptable toxicity . Cohorts 3-6 patient receive escalate dos MS-275 every 2-week schedule maximum tolerate dose ( MTD ) determine . Once MTD every 2-week schedule determine , patient receive treatment weekly schedule . The MTD determine weekly schedule . The MTD schedule define dose precede least 2 6 patient experience dose-limiting toxicity . Once MTD determine weekly schedule , 3 additional patient accrue receive MS-275 MTD weekly schedule . Disease status assess every 3 month . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 50-75 patient accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Histologically confirm malignancy metastatic unresectable effective standard curative palliative therapy exist Brain metastasis allow provide follow criterion meet : Received treatment brain metastasis Stable ≥ 6 month without steroid antiseizure medication PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 18 Performance status : ECOG 02 OR Karnofsky 50100 % Life expectancy : More 3 month Hematopoietic : WBC least 3,000/mm^3 Absolute neutrophil count least 1,500/mm^3 Platelet count least 100,000/mm^3 Hepatic : Bilirubin great 1.5 time upper limit normal ( ULN ) ( ≤ 3 mg/dL patient Gilbert 's syndrome ) AST/ALT great 2.5 time ULN Albumin least 75 % low limit normal Renal : Creatinine normal OR Creatinine clearance least 60 mL/min Cardiovascular : Cardiac ejection fraction normal MUGA No symptomatic congestive heart failure No unstable angina pectoris No cardiac arrhythmia Other : Not pregnant nursing Negative pregnancy test Fertile patient must use effective contraception Adequate oral intake No weight loss 10 % actual body weight within past 2 month No history allergic reaction compound similar chemical biological composition study drug No uncontrolled illness No ongoing active infection No seizure disorder No psychiatric illness social situation would preclude study compliance No acute chronic gastrointestinal condition ( e.g. , peptic ulcer colitis ) within past 2 month would interfere drug tolerance absorption Willing able selfadminister document dose MS275 PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : At least 4 week since prior anticancer vaccine therapy recover No concurrent immunotherapy Chemotherapy : At least 4 week since prior anticancer chemotherapy ( 6 week nitrosoureas mitomycin ) recover At least 8 week since prior UCN01 recover No concurrent chemotherapy Endocrine therapy : At least 4 week since prior anticancer hormonal therapy ( except gonadotropinreleasing hormone [ GnRH ] agonist ) recover Concurrent corticosteroid physiological replacement , antiemetic therapy , ongoing condition allow Must stable dose past 4 week No concurrent anticancer hormonal therapy except GnRH agonist noncastrated patient prostate cancer Radiotherapy : At least 4 week since prior anticancer radiotherapy recover No concurrent radiotherapy Concurrent localize radiotherapy single lesion allow patient achieves least partial response Surgery : At least 3 week since prior major surgery Other : No concurrent investigational commercial antineoplastic therapy
